CHAT.comment: letter is very short; Chi starts over a couple of times; Mot prompts Chi by giving suggestions of what to say; Chi gets frustrated (that's what the notes say -- it seems more like Mot is impatient at the end) so EXPs and Mot let Chi quit; Mot concerned about whether she can help or not (does Chi have to do own spelling?); Chi spells hi hiye even though Mot has spelled it out for him; he says (quote) what the heck I don't know what I'm doing; doesn't blindly follow Mot's spelling (Chi comments about how words grandma and grandpa share a lot of letters); a little of everything , including spelling out , negotiating whether to do the task at all , and talking about what goes in a letter

u.a: tells EXPs a story about her friend whose son wrote a letter to his grandmother in Chile; talks for about 25 seconds
context notes say that at some point Mot write how over hiye
in a scolding but soft tone
